On 28.01.2007, at 21:17, Bill de hOra wrote:

> I see what you're saying. But if the client doesn't get a response, or
> gets a non-2xx response what should it do, according to HTTP?

At least not go into "Brute Force Retry Mode" :-)
But I guess in this case it is ok. For my part, I'll follow the POST- 
to-POE-collection-factory road. Thanks for all the comments - this  
thing is trickier than it first appears.

Jan


--Apple-Mail-3-582572932
